description: Unique identifier for the inspection item record.
System date-time when this inspection item record was last created or updated; stored with millisecond precision. Timezone/source may be system default; confirm with SME.
Business name of the checklist task to be performed during inspection.
Technician guidance or instructions for performing the task and documenting findings.
Identifier of the inspection template/checklist to which this item belongs (foreign key; confirm with SME).
Readable reference for the related inspection template (e.g., code or name) used for display and reporting.
Legacy system’s primary key for this item, retained for migration/audit mapping.
Name of the source table in the legacy system from which this item originated.
Default option identifier selected in this item’s results dropdown, if a dropdown is used; confirm mapping.
Human-readable default option text corresponding to the default dropdown value.
Identifier of the service class or maintenance program this item applies to (e.g., PM level); confirm definition.
Readable name/label of the associated service class or program for display and reports.
Configured action when the item fails (e.g., require notes, create repair, trigger workflow).
Expected input type or default value for capturing results on this item (e.g., numeric, text, none); confirm usage.
Result set or evaluation scheme allowed for this item (e.g., pass/fail, OK/Not OK, measurement).
Label shown to users next to the result input for this item.
Indicates whether the inspection item is inactive and should be hidden from new checklists.
If true, a failed result automatically flags the asset/work order as needing repair or follow-up.
Identifier of the grouping/section within the inspection where this item appears.
Readable name of the inspection group/section for this item.
Code classifying the type of component or system inspected (e.g., brakes, lights); confirm taxonomy.
Readable category name corresponding to the item category for display and analytics.
Whether this item is auto-added to a checklist even when no work order or issuance exists; confirm behavior.
Sequence number determining the display order of this item within the checklist.
